description: ULTIMATE COMPREHENSIVE NUTRIGENOMICS DATABASE - 125+ variants covering ALL major nutrigenomic categories. Professional-grade clinical nutrition genetics for personalized diet, supplementation, and disease prevention.
categories: Vitamin Metabolism (D, B12, Folate/B9, A, E, K, B6)
Mineral Metabolism (Iron/Hemochromatosis, Calcium, Zinc, Copper, Magnesium, Sodium)
Lipid Metabolism (APOE/Alzheimer's, APOA5, Cholesterol, HDL/LDL, Triglycerides)

interpretation.plain_language: ADH1B*2 metabolizes alcohol 40x FASTER. TT very common in East Asians (~70%). Causes rapid acetaldehyde accumulation (with ALDH2*2) → flush. STRONGLY protective against alcoholism.
interpretation.effect: TT = 40x faster metabolism, protective against alcoholism
recommendations: TT genotype + ALDH2*2: AVOID alcohol (severe flush)
TT alone: Very fast metabolism, protective against AUD

interpretation.plain_language: Additional marker near ALDH2 gene. Use with rs671 for complete alcohol metabolism assessment.
recommendations: Use with rs671 for definitive ALDH2 status

interpretation.plain_language: ⛔ CRITICAL: ALDH2*2 causes aldehyde dehydrogenase deficiency. AA = NO enzyme. GA = reduced enzyme. Causes alcohol flush (Asian flush). STRONGLY protective against alcoholism BUT 10-20x INCREASED esophageal/stomach cancer risk if drink despite flushing. LIFE-THREATENING if ignored. ~40% East Asians affected.
interpretation.effect: AA = no enzyme (severe flush), GA = reduced (moderate flush)
recommendations: - Tell doctor: nitroglycerin may not work
GA genotype: STRONGLY limit alcohol, still cancer risk

interpretation.plain_language: SOD2 is primary mitochondrial antioxidant. GG (Val/Val) = reduced mitochondrial import → lower antioxidant defense. Important for aging, cancer, exercise recovery.
recommendations: - Increase dietary antioxidants: berries, dark chocolate, green tea

interpretation.plain_language: FTO variant affecting appetite and satiety. AA genotype associated with reduced satiety, increased food intake. High-protein diet particularly beneficial - increases fullness more than in TT individuals.
interpretation.effect: AA = reduced satiety, benefit more from protein
interpretation.clinical_action: AA genotype: High-protein diet (1.2-1.6g/kg body weight) critical for appetite control.
recommendations: - High-protein breakfast reduces hunger all day

interpretation.plain_language: MAOA affects serotonin, dopamine metabolism. Low-activity variant (T in males, TT in females) affects mood, may interact with diet/stress.
ABCC11 determines earwax type with ~100% accuracy. TT = dry earwax + minimal body odor (no deodorant needed). CC = wet earwax. TT ~90-95% East Asian, ~2% European.
interpretation.effect: TT = dry earwax + minimal odor, CC = wet earwax
recommendations: TT genotype: Dry earwax, reduced body odor, don't need deodorant

interpretation.plain_language: ⚠️ CARDIOVASCULAR RISK: CYP1A2 *1F determines caffeine metabolism. CC = SLOW (caffeine stays 6-8 hours). AA = FAST (clears 3-4 hours). CRITICAL: Slow metabolizers + 4+ cups coffee = 36% INCREASED heart attack risk. Fast metabolizers + 4+ cups = 36% REDUCED risk. Major gene-environment interaction.
interpretation.effect: CC = slow metabolizer, AA = fast metabolizer
recommendations: AC genotype: Moderate intake 2-3 cups OK
AA genotype (FAST): Coffee PROTECTIVE, 4+ cups = lower CVD risk

interpretation.plain_language: CASR (calcium-sensing receptor) regulates calcium homeostasis. Variants affect calcium sensing, parathyroid hormone secretion, and calcium balance. May influence calcium requirements.
interpretation.clinical_action: Monitor calcium levels. Ensure adequate intake.
recommendations: - Get calcium + PTH tested if symptoms of imbalance

interpretation.plain_language: CDKN2A/B locus affects beta cell function (insulin secretion). TT genotype = increased T2D risk.
CRY2 circadian clock gene affects glucose metabolism. Links sleep/circadian rhythm to diabetes risk.
Additional CRY2 variant linked to glucose metabolism and circadian function.
interpretation.effect: AA = circadian disruption effects on glucose

interpretation.plain_language: GCKR regulates glucokinase (glucose sensor). TT genotype = higher fasting glucose but lower triglycerides. Paradoxical effects on metabolism.
interpretation.effect: TT = elevated fasting glucose, BUT lower triglycerides

interpretation.plain_language: INADL affects insulin secretion in response to glucose.
MTNR1B melatonin receptor variant affects fasting glucose and diabetes risk. GG genotype = higher fasting glucose, increased T2D risk. Links sleep/circadian rhythm to glucose metabolism.
interpretation.effect: GG = elevated fasting glucose, higher T2D risk

interpretation.plain_language: SLC30A8 zinc transporter affects insulin secretion. TT genotype = reduced function = higher T2D risk. Zinc is critical for insulin function. Links zinc nutrition to diabetes risk.
interpretation.effect: TT = impaired insulin secretion, higher T2D risk
recommendations: TT genotype: Ensure adequate zinc (11-15mg daily)
Zinc-rich foods: oysters, beef, pumpkin seeds

interpretation.plain_language: ⚠️ TCF7L2 rs7903146 is THE strongest common genetic variant for type 2 diabetes. TT genotype increases T2D risk 80-100% (nearly doubles risk). Affects insulin secretion and glucose regulation. Low-carb/low-GI diet particularly beneficial for risk allele carriers.
interpretation.effect: TT = 80-100% increased T2D risk, impaired insulin secretion
interpretation.clinical_action: ⚠️ TT genotype: HIGH diabetes risk. Low-carb or low-glycemic index diet critical. Regular glucose monitoring. Preventive metformin consideration.
recommendations: - Low-carb diet (100-150g/day) OR low-glycemic index diet
- Avoid: white bread, white rice, sugary drinks, sweets
- Emphasize: vegetables, lean protein, healthy fats, whole grains
- Weight loss if overweight (each 1kg lost = 16% risk reduction)
- Get fasting glucose + HbA1c tested annually
- Consider CGM (continuous glucose monitor) to see response
- Discuss preventive metformin with doctor if prediabetic
CT genotype: Moderate risk, same recommendations
CC genotype: Lower genetic risk, standard guidelines

variants.trait: Circadian Rhythm - Evening vs Morning Person

interpretation.plain_language: CLOCK gene affects circadian rhythm preference. CC genotype = evening preference ('night owl'). Also affects weight loss response and diabetes risk.
interpretation.effect: CC = evening preference, may have harder time with weight loss
recommendations: - Later eating may be more natural for you
- Exercise timing: afternoon/evening may be better
- Consider your chronotype when planning meals
- Still try to maintain regular schedule

interpretation.plain_language: IL10 affects production of interleukin-10 (anti-inflammatory cytokine). Variants affect IL-10 levels and inflammatory balance. Important for autoimmune disease risk and inflammation control.
interpretation.clinical_action: Lower IL-10 producers: Anti-inflammatory diet and lifestyle particularly important.

interpretation.plain_language: IL6 -174G>C affects interleukin-6 production (inflammatory cytokine). GG genotype associated with higher IL-6, more inflammation. Exercise and anti-inflammatory diet particularly important. May affect exercise recovery.
interpretation.clinical_action: GG genotype: Anti-inflammatory diet, regular exercise (paradoxically reduces chronic IL-6 despite acute increase).
recommendations: * Limit: sugar, refined carbs, trans fats
- Adequate sleep (inflammation increases with sleep debt)
- Consider omega-3 supplement if not eating fish

interpretation.plain_language: GSTP1 Ile105Val affects glutathione S-transferase Pi, critical Phase II detox enzyme. Conjugates toxins with glutathione for excretion. GG (Val/Val) has altered activity - may affect chemotherapy response, toxin clearance.
interpretation.clinical_action: GG genotype: Support glutathione production through diet and supplements.
recommendations: - Limit toxin exposure: alcohol, smoking, pollution

interpretation.plain_language: NQO1 P187S affects Phase II detoxification enzyme that protects against quinones and oxidative stress. TT genotype = NO enzyme activity (10-20% of population).
recommendations: - Cruciferous vegetables (induce other Phase II enzymes)

interpretation.plain_language: PON1 Q192R affects paraoxonase enzyme that detoxifies organophosphates (pesticides) and protects against oxidized LDL.
interpretation.effect: AA (RR) = different detox capacity for organophosphates

interpretation.plain_language: PON1 L55M affects enzyme activity and stability. TT (MM) = lower activity.
XPC affects nucleotide excision repair (NER) that fixes UV-induced DNA damage. TT genotype = increased skin cancer risk with sun exposure.
interpretation.effect: TT = reduced DNA repair, higher skin cancer risk

interpretation.plain_language: Third FADS1 cluster marker for comprehensive omega-3 conversion assessment.
recommendations: Use all FADS markers for complete phenotype

interpretation.plain_language: Fourth FADS cluster marker for complete haplotype determination.
recommendations: Complete FADS assessment with all markers

interpretation.plain_language: Additional FADS2 variant for omega-3/6 conversion phenotype.
FADS2 upstream of FADS1 in omega-3/6 pathway. Works with FADS1 to determine overall conversion efficiency. T allele = lower conversion.
recommendations: TT genotype: Same as FADS1 - need fish/fish oil
Compound poor converter (FADS1 + FADS2): Critical to supplement

interpretation.plain_language: APOA2 -265T>C affects response to saturated fat intake. GG genotype (CC in traditional notation) associated with increased obesity risk with HIGH saturated fat intake (>22g/day), but not with low saturated fat. AA genotype: no effect of saturated fat on weight. This is a gene-diet interaction.
interpretation.effect: GG = obesity risk with high sat fat, AA = unaffected by sat fat
interpretation.clinical_action: GG genotype: LIMIT saturated fat to <20g/day. AA genotype: Saturated fat intake doesn't affect weight.
recommendations: - Avoid: butter, cream, fatty meat, full-fat dairy, coconut oil
- Choose: lean meats, low-fat dairy, olive oil, avocado
- High sat fat = significant weight gain for you
- Weight unaffected by saturated fat intake
- Still follow heart-healthy diet for other reasons

interpretation.plain_language: FABP2 Ala54Thr affects intestinal fatty acid binding protein. TT (Thr/Thr) = 2x better fat absorption = weight gain with high-fat diet. Low-fat diet more effective for weight loss.
interpretation.effect: TT = efficient fat absorption, weight gain with high fat
recommendations: TT genotype: LOW-FAT diet for weight loss

interpretation.plain_language: PLIN1 (perilipin) affects how fat is stored in adipocytes. Variants influence weight loss response to different diets. Some genotypes respond better to low-carb, others to low-fat.
recommendations: May respond better to specific diet type

interpretation.plain_language: PPARG Pro12Ala affects fat storage and insulin sensitivity. G allele (Ala12) is protective - better insulin sensitivity, lower type 2 diabetes risk (~25% reduced), but may have slightly higher BMI. C allele (Pro12) associated with slightly higher T2D risk but easier weight loss.
interpretation.effect: GG = best insulin sensitivity, CC = easier weight loss response
interpretation.clinical_action: GG genotype: Better insulin sensitivity but may store fat easily. CC: Low-fat diet more effective.
recommendations: - May gain weight easily - watch portions
- Exercise very important for weight management
- Low-fat diet more effective for weight loss

interpretation.plain_language: ⚠️ CRITICAL: MTHFR C677T reduces enzyme 30-70%. AA (TT) = thermolabile variant, severely impaired folate metabolism. Causes elevated homocysteine (CVD risk). ESSENTIAL for pregnancy - prevents neural tube defects. 10-15% population is TT.
recommendations: - Increase folate-rich foods: leafy greens, legumes

interpretation.plain_language: MTHFR A1298C has milder effect than C677T (~20-30% reduction). However, compound heterozygotes (677T + 1298C) significantly impaired.
SLC19A1/RFC1 transports folate into cells. G80A variant may reduce transport, affecting cellular folate. Relevant for methotrexate response.
recommendations: If on methotrexate: Discuss with oncologist

interpretation.plain_language: CYP17A1 affects steroid hormone synthesis. May influence blood pressure, mineral balance. Linked to hypertension risk in some studies.
interpretation.clinical_action: Monitor blood pressure if risk allele present. Low-sodium diet may be beneficial.
recommendations: - Increase potassium: bananas, potatoes, leafy greens

interpretation.plain_language: CRP variant affects baseline C-reactive protein (inflammation marker). Higher CRP = CVD risk. Genetic component accounts for ~40% of CRP variance.
recommendations: Get hs-CRP tested for cardiovascular risk
Anti-inflammatory diet if elevated: omega-3, colorful produce, limit refined carbs

interpretation.plain_language: Additional IL-10 promoter variant affecting anti-inflammatory cytokine production.

HFE H63D increases iron absorption. GG genotype = 20-30% increased absorption. Can lead to iron overload, especially in men. Combined with C282Y (compound heterozygote) causes moderate hemochromatosis.

⛔ CRITICAL: HFE C282Y is THE major hemochromatosis mutation. AA genotype = hereditary hemochromatosis in ~70% of cases. Causes massive iron overload → liver cirrhosis, diabetes, heart failure, arthritis. ~0.5% are AA (high risk). LIFE-THREATENING if untreated but easily managed with phlebotomy.
recommendations: - GET TESTED IMMEDIATELY: Ferritin + Transferrin Saturation
- If ferritin >1000: URGENT - liver damage risk

interpretation.plain_language: Additional lactase persistence marker. Use with rs4988235 for complete assessment.

⚠️ DEFINITIVE TEST: LCT/MCM6 determines lactase persistence into adulthood. GG genotype = lactase persistence = can digest lactose. TT genotype = lactase non-persistence = lactose intolerant. This is ONE OF THE MOST CLEAR-CUT nutrigenomic findings. 75% of world is TT.
interpretation.effect: TT = lactose intolerant (definitive), GT = partial, GG = tolerant
recommendations: - Avoid milk, ice cream, soft cheeses
GT genotype: Partial lactase, small amounts may be OK
GG genotype: No genetic lactose intolerance

interpretation.plain_language: APOA5 strongly affects triglyceride levels. GG genotype = higher triglycerides. BUT: Responds VERY well to omega-3 supplementation (fish oil). This is a gene-nutrient interaction.
interpretation.effect: GG = high triglycerides BUT excellent omega-3 response
recommendations: GG genotype: Fish oil 2-4g EPA+DHA daily VERY beneficial
You respond better to omega-3 than most people

interpretation.plain_language: Additional APOA5 variant affecting triglycerides. Combined with rs964184 for complete APOA5 assessment.

variants.trait: APOE ε4 Allele - Alzheimer's & Fat Response

interpretation.plain_language: ⚠️ APOE ε4 (CC at this position + TT at rs7412) = major Alzheimer's risk allele. Also affects fat metabolism, cholesterol, vitamin E needs. ε4 carriers respond BETTER to low-saturated-fat diet for cholesterol reduction.
interpretation.effect: CC = ε4/ε4 = very high Alzheimer's risk, altered fat metabolism
recommendations: ⚠️ ε4 carriers: LOW saturated fat diet CRITICAL
Consider APOE genotyping if family history

variants.trait: APOE ε2 Allele - Protective & Fat Response

interpretation.plain_language: APOE ε2 (TT at this position) is PROTECTIVE against Alzheimer's. Also lowers cholesterol. Use both rs429358 + rs7412 to determine APOE genotype: ε2/ε2, ε2/ε3, ε2/ε4, ε3/ε3, ε3/ε4, ε4/ε4.
interpretation.effect: TT = ε2 allele = Alzheimer's protection, lower cholesterol
recommendations: May have higher triglycerides with high-carb diet

interpretation.plain_language: Additional variant in APOE region affecting cholesterol and Alzheimer's risk.
recommendations: Use with rs429358 and rs7412 for complete APOE assessment

interpretation.plain_language: SORT1 locus strongly affects LDL cholesterol. TT genotype = higher LDL.
recommendations: Consider statins if very high LDL

interpretation.plain_language: CETP affects HDL (good cholesterol) levels. AA genotype = higher HDL = better cardiovascular protection. CETP inhibitors are drugs that mimic this genetic advantage.
interpretation.effect: AA = higher HDL (protective), CC = lower HDL
recommendations: CC genotype: Focus on raising HDL:

interpretation.plain_language: Additional CETP variant affecting HDL cholesterol levels.
CLU (clusterin) is second-strongest genetic risk factor for Alzheimer's after APOE. Also affects lipid metabolism.
KLF14 transcription factor affects HDL and triglyceride levels.
LIPC affects hepatic lipase activity and HDL levels. TT genotype = higher HDL (protective).
recommendations: CC genotype: Focus on HDL-raising strategies

interpretation.plain_language: LPL affects triglyceride clearance. Rare G allele (S447X stop codon) is HIGHLY protective - lower triglycerides, lower CVD risk. One of the most beneficial genetic variants.
interpretation.effect: CG or GG = lower triglycerides, reduced CVD risk
recommendations: G allele carriers: Natural advantage for heart health

interpretation.plain_language: TRIB1 affects lipid metabolism and liver function.
FTO variant affects thermogenesis (heat production/calorie burning). CC genotype associated with reduced energy expenditure, easier fat storage. Physical activity particularly important.
interpretation.effect: CC = reduced thermogenesis, need more exercise
interpretation.clinical_action: CC genotype: Increase physical activity, avoid sedentary behavior.
recommendations: - Include resistance training (builds muscle = increases metabolism)
- Cold exposure may help (activates brown fat)

interpretation.plain_language: MTR (methionine synthase) requires B12 as cofactor. Variant affects enzyme activity and B12 utilization.
interpretation.effect: GG = reduced activity, higher homocysteine risk

interpretation.plain_language: MTRR regenerates B12 for methionine synthase. Important for methylation cycle, especially with MTHFR variants.
interpretation.effect: GG = reduced activity with MTHFR variants
recommendations: GG + MTHFR variants: B-vitamin support critical

interpretation.plain_language: ABCG2 transporter affects uric acid excretion. TT genotype = higher uric acid = gout risk. Diet can help.
interpretation.effect: TT = elevated uric acid, increased gout risk

interpretation.plain_language: NAT1 (different from NAT2) affects acetylation of aromatic amines and some drugs.

NAT2 slow acetylator status (covered in PGx) also affects detoxification of environmental toxins, arylamines (from cooked meat), and various xenobiotics. Slow acetylators have prolonged exposure to these compounds.
interpretation.effect: CC = slow acetylator (2 slow alleles needed)
interpretation.clinical_action: Slow acetylators: Reduce exposure to NAT2-metabolized toxins. Limit well-done/charred meat.
recommendations: - Coffee may be protective (increases NAT2 activity)

interpretation.plain_language: Additional NAT2 variant defining slow acetylator status. Combine with rs1801280 and other NAT2 SNPs for complete phenotype.
Additional NAT2 marker for acetylator phenotype determination.
OR6A2 olfactory receptor variant causes cilantro to taste soapy/metallic. If you have the variant, cilantro genuinely tastes like soap - it's genetics, not preference. ~10-20% affected.
recommendations: GG genotype: Cilantro tastes like soap (genetic)

interpretation.plain_language: TAS2R38 determines bitter taste sensitivity. CC (PAV/PAV) = SUPERTASTER (very sensitive). GG (AVI/AVI) = non-taster. Supertasters often dislike broccoli, Brussels sprouts, kale - cancer-protective foods. Has health implications.
interpretation.effect: CC = supertaster (25-35%), CG = medium, GG = non-taster (25%)
recommendations: - May be sensitive to alcohol bitterness
GG: Can't taste PTC/PROP, may enjoy vegetables easily

interpretation.plain_language: ⚠️ IMPORTANT: BCMO1 converts beta-carotene (plants) to retinol (vitamin A). 45% have reduced conversion (32-69%). AA genotype = CANNOT efficiently make vitamin A from carrots. MUST get preformed vitamin A from animal sources or supplements. CRITICAL for vegans.
interpretation.effect: AA = 32-69% reduced conversion (can't make vitamin A from carrots!)
recommendations: - MUST eat preformed vitamin A: liver, fish, eggs, dairy
- Do NOT rely on carrots/sweet potatoes
- Monitor for deficiency: night blindness, dry skin
AG: Mix of preformed + provitamin A
GG: Can rely on plant sources effectively

interpretation.plain_language: Second major BCMO1 variant. Together with rs6013897 determines conversion phenotype.
⚠️ CRITICAL: FUT2 determines secretor status. AA (non-secretor) = 15-25% reduced B12 absorption. ONE OF THE MOST IMPORTANT nutrigenomic variants. ~20% Europeans are non-secretors. MUST supplement.
recommendations: ⚠️ AA (non-secretor): HIGH RISK for B12 deficiency
Get B12 + MMA tested NOW - likely deficient
Increase B12-rich foods: meat, fish, eggs
Retest in 3 months - target B12 >400 pg/mL

interpretation.plain_language: ALPL affects alkaline phosphatase which activates vitamin B6. Variants may affect B6 needs.
Additional ALPL variant affecting B6 activation.
interpretation.effect: May need more B6 or active form (P5P)

interpretation.plain_language: ⚠️ CYP2R1 is primary enzyme converting vitamin D to 25(OH)D. GG genotype = 20% lower 25(OH)D. HIGH RISK for deficiency.
interpretation.effect: GG = significantly lower vitamin D levels
recommendations: ⚠️ GG genotype: HIGH RISK for deficiency

interpretation.plain_language: DHCR7 affects 7-dehydrocholesterol levels (substrate for vitamin D synthesis in skin). Variants may affect vitamin D production from sun exposure.
interpretation.effect: May affect vitamin D synthesis efficiency
interpretation.clinical_action: Monitor vitamin D levels. May need supplementation despite sun exposure.

interpretation.plain_language: DHCR7 affects 7-dehydrocholesterol (substrate for vitamin D synthesis). Variants affect how efficiently your skin makes vitamin D from sunlight.
recommendations: May need more sun exposure or supplementation

interpretation.plain_language: Additional DHCR7 variant affecting vitamin D synthesis substrate availability.
recommendations: Use with other DHCR7 variants for complete picture

interpretation.plain_language: GC encodes vitamin D binding protein. TT = lower 25(OH)D levels but potentially better bone health (less D bound, more free).
recommendations: TT genotype: Monitor vitamin D, may need moderate supplementation (1000-2000 IU)
Paradoxically may have normal bone health despite lower D

interpretation.plain_language: Together with rs4588, defines GC haplotypes (Gc1f, Gc1s, Gc2). Gc1f = highest D levels, Gc2 = lowest.
recommendations: Gc2/2: Highest deficiency risk - supplement 2000+ IU

interpretation.plain_language: With rs7041, defines GC haplotypes affecting vitamin D status. Critical SNP for vitamin D genetics.
recommendations: Combined with rs7041 gives complete picture

interpretation.plain_language: VDR BsmI variant may affect vitamin D receptor function and bone health. Interacts with other VDR variants (TaqI, FokI).
interpretation.clinical_action: TT genotype: Ensure adequate calcium and vitamin D. Monitor bone health.

interpretation.plain_language: VDR FokI creates start codon polymorphism resulting in longer/shorter VDR protein. TT (ff) produces shorter, more active receptor. CC (FF) produces longer, less active receptor. Affects vitamin D response and bone density.
interpretation.effect: CC = less active VDR, may need more vitamin D
recommendations: CC genotype: Higher vitamin D doses may be beneficial (2000-3000 IU)

interpretation.plain_language: VDR TaqI affects VDR mRNA stability. May influence calcium absorption and bone density.
interpretation.effect: AA may have reduced calcium absorption

interpretation.plain_language: CYP2C9*2 affects warfarin (anticoagulant) metabolism AND vitamin K utilization. TT = reduced enzyme = warfarin sensitivity. Also relevant for vitamin K needs.
interpretation.effect: TT = warfarin sensitive, altered vitamin K effects
recommendations: If on warfarin: Lower dose needed (covered in PGx)
Leafy greens important but be consistent

variants.trait: Vitamin K Epoxide Reductase - Warfarin & Vitamin K

interpretation.plain_language: VKORC1 recycles vitamin K. Major determinant of warfarin dose (covered in PGx). TT genotype = lower vitamin K recycling = higher warfarin sensitivity = may need higher vitamin K intake.
interpretation.effect: TT = reduced vitamin K recycling, warfarin sensitive
recommendations: If on warfarin: Consistent vitamin K intake critical

interpretation.plain_language: BDNF affects appetite regulation and obesity risk. Also important for brain health, mood, cognitive function.
interpretation.effect: AA = higher obesity risk, may affect mood

interpretation.plain_language: ⚠️ FTO is THE strongest common genetic variant for obesity. AA genotype increases obesity risk 67%, adds ~3kg body weight on average. HOWEVER: Effect is completely preventable with lifestyle. AA individuals benefit MORE from physical activity and high-protein diets than others. Risk is modifiable.
interpretation.effect: AA = 67% increased obesity risk, +3kg average weight, but PREVENTABLE
interpretation.clinical_action: ⚠️ AA genotype: High genetic obesity risk BUT highly modifiable. Physical activity and protein intake critical. Exercise benefits you MORE than others.
recommendations: ⚠️ AA genotype (HIGH OBESITY RISK - but modifiable):
- Physical activity CRITICAL: 30+ min daily exercise
- Exercise benefits you MORE than TT genotype (cancels genetic risk)
- High-protein diet (25-30% calories): Protein reduces hunger more for you
- Sleep 7-9 hours (poor sleep increases risk more)
- GOOD NEWS: Lifestyle completely overcomes genetic risk
AT genotype: Moderate risk, same recommendations
TT genotype: Low genetic risk, standard guidelines

interpretation.plain_language: Additional FTO variant affecting appetite and satiety. GG genotype = reduced satiety signals.
GNPDA2 affects obesity through glucosamine metabolism pathway.
MC4R is second-strongest common obesity gene after FTO. CC genotype = increased obesity risk, higher BMI. Protein-rich breakfast especially beneficial.
interpretation.effect: CC = increased obesity risk (+0.5 BMI units)
recommendations: Eating timing matters - avoid late-night meals

interpretation.plain_language: NEGR1 affects obesity risk through neuronal regulation of energy balance.
Childhood obesity risk variant. CC genotype associated with higher BMI in children.
recommendations: Focus on childhood nutrition if relevant
